benchmark_details.name: ConQRet (Controversial Questions for Argumentation and Retrieval)
benchmark_details.overview: ConQRet is a new benchmark featuring long and complex human-authored arguments on debated topics, grounded in real-world websites, allowing an exhaustive evaluation across retrieval effectiveness, argument quality, and groundedness.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enable research on complex, evidence-based argumentation and improve automated evaluation methods for retrieval-augmented argumentation systems.

data.source: ProCon.org, a debate portal featuring controversial questions with expert-generated pro and con arguments.
data.annotation: Human annotation for argument quality across multiple dimensions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed based on correlations with human evaluators and inter-annotator agreement.
methodology.interpretation: Metrics indicate the effectiveness of retrieval and argument quality across various dimensions.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison with previous argumentation frameworks shows improved performance using LLM Judges.
methodology.validation: Validated using both a prior dataset and the newly introduced ConQRet benchmark.
